description: For a line L in the plane, let C(L) denote the number of prime points [k, prime(k)] on L, and let M(L) denote the maximum prime(k) for any of these points. a(n) is the maximum of the smallest primes in the lines L with C(L) = n and containing prime A376187(n), or a(n) = -1 if no such lines exist.
